solution_line_template: If the bakery can make {pies_made} pies, this means there would be {pies_made} * {pieces_per_pie} = <<{pies_made}*{pieces_per_pie}={total_pieces}>>{total_pieces} pie pieces.
For all the pieces the bakery would make {total_pieces} * {price_per_piece} = $<<{total_pieces}*{price_per_piece}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}.
The cost of making {pies_made} pies is {pies_made} * {cost_per_pie} = $<<{pies_made}*{cost_per_pie}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
That means the bakery would make {total_revenue} - {total_cost} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_cost}={net_profit}>>{net_profit}.
